result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel E. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joel E. Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joel E. Brown was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
(14CF68, 14CF277, 15CF89 & 15CF192) Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; Court reviews plea agreement; NGI pleas other than the plea in 14CF277 are withdrawan; Court reviews def's rights; Court reveiws chgs and pens; no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 14CF68 w/o enhancer; no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 15CF192, no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 15CF89; no contest/NGI plea is entered in 14CF277 all counts; parties stipulate to facts; Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty as follows: count 1 w/o penalty enhancer in 14CF68 and count 2 is dismissed; guilty of count 1 of 15CF192 w/counts 2 & 3 dismissed and count 4 is dismissed and read in; guilty of count 1 in 15CF89 and counts 4 & 5 are dismissed and read in and remaining counts are dismissed; Court accepts plea of no contest/NGI in 14CF277 all counts and finds defendant guilty/NGI; Court heard and will order a 4 year commitment to DHS inpatient; Parties make sentencing arguments; defendant makes statement; Court heard and sentence is imposed:

15CF192:
108 day DCJ concurrent w/h&t w/83 days credit - time served
costs

15CF89:
50 days DCJ concurrent w/h&t w/39 days credit - time served
costs

14CF68:
w/h
5 yr P&P
1 year DCJ - imposed & stayed to be used on recommendation to the Court for ATR
Shall maintain compliance w/any drug and alcohol and mental health treatment
shall maintain absolute sobriety from all drugs othe+
shall not take any drugs except those prescribed by a doctor and taken in accordance w/prescription
shall notify any doctor of opiate addiction
Is to involve self in regular treatment for drugs issues
costs (shall collect costs in all matters)
allowing defendant to participate by telephone

Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to allow defendant be allowed one hour's use of the phone for a medical assessment, bail/bond motion would be addressed after that.  State has no objection to that phone call, but requested bail/bond motion be denied today until the terms of the modification are more clearly defined. Court held the bail/bond motion in abeyance and granted the one hour phone call with the assessing agency. Attorney Vollan to draft the order with details concerning the logistics of the phone call, with approval of the DA.

Motion hearing at 08-03-2015 08:15 am.
Motion hearing at 08-19-2015 09:00 am.

Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews def's rights to prelim hrg on the record; defendant waives prelim hrg;  Arraignment scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim, victim's mother, victim's children and their residence(s).

Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (eligible).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $30,000 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim JR, victim's mother, victim's children CMM & JBB and their residence(s).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
